languages.text: "Понимаю ход ваших мыслей: Летус выглядел выгребной ямой отчаяния и безумия, а раз за хранение десятины отвечают арбитры, то и вывод простой. Простой, но неверный. Попробуйте посмотреть с другой стороны: Лекс Империалис дает четкую директиву к действию, надо лишь следовать ей. Гвардейцы могли смиренно ждать, клерк — покаяться в незавершенной работе. Но они выбрали свои слабости и пороки. Так что на самом деле несет вред?"

"I can understand your thought process. Leethus seemed like a cesspit of madness and despair, and since the Arbitrators are in charge of storing the tithe, the conclusion is simple. Simple, but wrong. Try to look at it from a different angle: the Lex Imperialis gives us a clear directive, and all we need to do is follow it. The Guardsmen could have waited in humble obedience. The clerk could have expressed remorse for failing to finish his work. Instead, they chose their weaknesses and vices. So, what is the true cause of harm here, I wonder?"
languages.original_text: "Понимаю ход ваших мыслей: Летус выглядел выгребной ямой отчаяния и безумия, а раз за хранение десятины отвечают арбитры, то и вывод простой. Простой, но неверный. Попробуйте посмотреть с другой стороны: Лекс Империалис дает четкую директиву к действию, надо лишь следовать ей. Гвардейцы могли смиренно ждать, клерк — покаяться в незавершенной работе. languages.text: 「あなたの考え方は理解できます。リーザスは狂気と絶望の吹き溜まりのように見えました。アービトレイターが租税の保管を担っているなら、結論は単純です。単純ですが、間違っています。別の視点から見てください。レックス・インペリアは明確な指針を与えており、私たちはそれに従えばよいだけです。ガーズマンは謙虚に従いながら待つこともできました。事務員は、自らの職務を全うできなかったことを悔いることもできました。なのに彼らは、自らの弱さと堕落を選んだのです。では、真に害をもたらしたのは何だったのでしょう？」
languages.original_text: "I can understand your thought process. Leethus seemed like a cesspit of madness and despair, and since the Arbitrators are in charge of storing the tithe, the conclusion is simple. Simple, but wrong. Try to look at it from a different angle: the Lex Imperialis gives us a clear directive, and all we need to do is follow it. The Guardsmen could have waited in humble obedience. The clerk could have expressed remorse for failing to finish his work. Instead, they chose their weaknesses and vices. So, what is the true cause of harm here, I wonder?"

traits.locale_text: 「あなたの考え方は理解できます。リーザスは狂気と絶望の吹き溜まりのように見えました。アービトレイターが租税の保管を担っているなら、結論は単純です。単純ですが、間違っています。別の視点から見てください。レックス・インペリアは明確な指針を与えており、私たちはそれに従えばよいだけです。ガーズマンは謙虚に従いながら待つこともできました。事務員は、自らの職務を全うできなかったことを悔いることもできました。なのに彼らは、自らの弱さと堕落を選んだのです。では、真に害をもたらしたのは何だったのでしょう？」

languages.text: "Ich kann Eure Gedankengänge nachvollziehen. Leethus schien eine Jauchegrube voller Wahnsinn und Verzweiflung zu sein, und da die Arbitratoren für die Lagerung des Zehnts verantwortlich sind, ist die Schlussfolgerung simpel. Simpel, aber falsch. Versucht es mal mit einer anderen Perspektive: Das Lex Imperia gibt uns eine klare Vorgabe, die wir lediglich befolgen müssen. Die Gardisten hätten in demütigem Gehorsam warten können. Der Beamte hätte mehr Bedauern zeigen können, weil er seine Arbeit nicht abschließen konnte. Stattdessen gaben sie ihren Schwächen und Lastern nach. Ich frage also: Was ist hier die wahre Ursache des Schadens?"
languages.original_text: "I can understand your thought process. Leethus seemed like a cesspit of madness and despair, and since the Arbitrators are in charge of storing the tithe, the conclusion is simple. Simple, but wrong. Try to look at it from a different angle: the Lex Imperialis gives us a clear directive, and all we need to do is follow it. The Guardsmen could have waited in humble obedience. The clerk could have expressed remorse for failing to finish his work. Instead, they chose their weaknesses and vices. So, what is the true cause of harm here, I wonder?"

traits.locale_text: "Ich kann Eure Gedankengänge nachvollziehen. Leethus schien eine Jauchegrube voller Wahnsinn und Verzweiflung zu sein, und da die Arbitratoren für die Lagerung des Zehnts verantwortlich sind, ist die Schlussfolgerung simpel. Simpel, aber falsch. Versucht es mal mit einer anderen Perspektive: Das Lex Imperia gibt uns eine klare Vorgabe, die wir lediglich befolgen müssen. Die Gardisten hätten in demütigem Gehorsam warten können. Der Beamte hätte mehr Bedauern zeigen können, weil er seine Arbeit nicht abschließen konnte. Stattdessen gaben sie ihren Schwächen und Lastern nach. Ich frage also: Was ist hier die wahre Ursache des Schadens?"

languages.text: « Je comprends votre cheminement de pensée. Leethus était un véritable cloaque en proie aux tourments et au désespoir, et comme les arbitrators y sont en charge de la dîme, il est facile de tirer une conclusion. Une conclusion certes logique, mais fausse. Essayez d'envisager la situation d'une autre manière : la Lex Imperialis nous indique clairement la voie à suivre, il ne nous reste qu'à l'accepter. Les gardes auraient pu patienter humblement. Le greffier aurait pu manifester des remords pour avoir échoué à accomplir son devoir. Au lieu de cela, ils ont préféré la faiblesse en cédant à leurs vices. Dites-moi donc, quelle est la véritable cause du mal, dans cette situation ? »
languages.original_text: "I can understand your thought process. Leethus seemed like a cesspit of madness and despair, and since the Arbitrators are in charge of storing the tithe, the conclusion is simple. Simple, but wrong. Try to look at it from a different angle: the Lex Imperialis gives us a clear directive, and all we need to do is follow it. The Guardsmen could have waited in humble obedience. The clerk could have expressed remorse for failing to finish his work. Instead, they chose their weaknesses and vices. So, what is the true cause of harm here, I wonder?"

traits.locale_text: « Je comprends votre cheminement de pensée. Leethus était un véritable cloaque en proie aux tourments et au désespoir, et comme les arbitrators y sont en charge de la dîme, il est facile de tirer une conclusion. Une conclusion certes logique, mais fausse. Essayez d'envisager la situation d'une autre manière : la Lex Imperialis nous indique clairement la voie à suivre, il ne nous reste qu'à l'accepter. Les gardes auraient pu patienter humblement. Le greffier aurait pu manifester des remords pour avoir échoué à accomplir son devoir. Au lieu de cela, ils ont préféré la faiblesse en cédant à leurs vices. Dites-moi donc, quelle est la véritable cause du mal, dans cette situation ? »

languages.text: «Puedo entender cómo ha llegado a esa conclusión. Leethus parecía una fosa séptica de locura y desesperación, y dado que los Arbitrator son los encargados de custodiar el diezmo, la conclusión es sencilla. Sencilla, pero errónea. Intente verlo desde una perspectiva distinta: la Lex Imperialis nos plantea una directiva clara, y lo único que debemos hacer es seguirla. La guardia imperial pudo haber esperado dócilmente. El funcionario pudo haberse arrepentido por no terminar su trabajo. Y en vez de eso, se decantaron por sus vicios y flaquezas. Así que yo me pregunto: ¿cuál es realmente el origen de ese mal que menciona usted?».
languages.original_text: "I can understand your thought process. Leethus seemed like a cesspit of madness and despair, and since the Arbitrators are in charge of storing the tithe, the conclusion is simple. Simple, but wrong. Try to look at it from a different angle: the Lex Imperialis gives us a clear directive, and all we need to do is follow it. The Guardsmen could have waited in humble obedience. The clerk could have expressed remorse for failing to finish his work. Instead, they chose their weaknesses and vices. So, what is the true cause of harm here, I wonder?"

traits.locale_text: «Puedo entender cómo ha llegado a esa conclusión. Leethus parecía una fosa séptica de locura y desesperación, y dado que los Arbitrator son los encargados de custodiar el diezmo, la conclusión es sencilla. Sencilla, pero errónea. Intente verlo desde una perspectiva distinta: la Lex Imperialis nos plantea una directiva clara, y lo único que debemos hacer es seguirla. La guardia imperial pudo haber esperado dócilmente. El funcionario pudo haberse arrepentido por no terminar su trabajo. Y en vez de eso, se decantaron por sus vicios y flaquezas. Así que yo me pregunto: ¿cuál es realmente el origen de ese mal que menciona usted?».

languages.text: “我能理解你的思路。利瑟斯就像个粪坑一样，充满了疯狂与绝望。考虑到看守什一税的人是法务官，我们似乎很容易就能得出简单的结论。然而，这个简单的结论却是错的。我们可以试着从另一个角度来看待这个问题——帝国律法明明已经给出了明确的指示，我们只要遵循它就好了。那些帝国卫队士兵本可以谦卑地等待下去，而那个职员也本可以忏悔自己未能完成工作，但实际上，他们每个人都听从了弱点与罪恶的召唤。既然如此，我不禁想问：造成问题的真正原因，究竟是什么呢？”
languages.original_text: "I can understand your thought process. Leethus seemed like a cesspit of madness and despair, and since the Arbitrators are in charge of storing the tithe, the conclusion is simple. Simple, but wrong. Try to look at it from a different angle: the Lex Imperialis gives us a clear directive, and all we need to do is follow it. The Guardsmen could have waited in humble obedience. The clerk could have expressed remorse for failing to finish his work. Instead, they chose their weaknesses and vices. So, what is the true cause of harm here, I wonder?"

traits.locale_text: “我能理解你的思路。利瑟斯就像个粪坑一样，充满了疯狂与绝望。考虑到看守什一税的人是法务官，我们似乎很容易就能得出简单的结论。然而，这个简单的结论却是错的。我们可以试着从另一个角度来看待这个问题——帝国律法明明已经给出了明确的指示，我们只要遵循它就好了。那些帝国卫队士兵本可以谦卑地等待下去，而那个职员也本可以忏悔自己未能完成工作，但实际上，他们每个人都听从了弱点与罪恶的召唤。既然如此，我不禁想问：造成问题的真正原因，究竟是什么呢？”

languages.text: "Düşünce akışınızı anlayabiliyorum. Sizin gözünüzden Leethus, deliliğin ve umutsuzluğun lağım çukuru. Ayrıca aşarı gözetmek de Yargıcıların sorumluluğu olduğu için varılacak sonuç apaçık ortada. Apaçık ortada ama yanlış. Farklı bir açıdan bakmaya çalışın. Lex İmperialis bize açıkça yol gösteriyor. Bizim de tek yapmamız gereken ona uymak. Muhafızlar, alçakgönüllü bir itaatle emirleri bekleyebilirdi. Kâtip, işini bitiremediği için pişmanlık duyabilirdi. Bunun yerine zayıflıklarına ve kusurlarına boyun eğdiler. Peki bu noktada zararın gerçek kaynağı nedir? Merak ediyorum."
languages.original_text: "I can understand your thought process. Leethus seemed like a cesspit of madness and despair, and since the Arbitrators are in charge of storing the tithe, the conclusion is simple. Simple, but wrong. Try to look at it from a different angle: the Lex Imperialis gives us a clear directive, and all we need to do is follow it. The Guardsmen could have waited in humble obedience. The clerk could have expressed remorse for failing to finish his work. Instead, they chose their weaknesses and vices. So, what is the true cause of harm here, I wonder?"

traits.locale_text: "Düşünce akışınızı anlayabiliyorum. Sizin gözünüzden Leethus, deliliğin ve umutsuzluğun lağım çukuru. Ayrıca, aşarı gözetmek de Yargıcıların sorumluluğu olduğu için varılacak sonuç apaçık ortada. Apaçık ortada ama yanlış. Farklı bir açıdan bakmaya çalışın. Lex Imperialis bize berrak bir kılavuz veriyor. Bizim de tek yapmamız gereken bu kılavuzu takip etmek. Muhafızlar alçakgönüllü bir itaatle emirleri bekleyebilirdi. Kâtip işini bitiremediği için pişmanlık duyabilirdi. Bunun yerine zayıflıklarına ve kusurlarına boyun eğdiler. Peki, bu noktada zararın gerçek kaynağı nedir? Merak ediyorum."
